Understate: The claim underestimates the extent of the controversy and ongoing debate surrounding the Arizona immigration law.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or support to prove that the late changes to the law definitively address the concerns of racial profiling.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the changes made to the law will completely eliminate the possibility of racial profiling, without providing substantial evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the possibility that the changes to the law may not be sufficient to prevent racial profiling, or that other factors may still contribute to the possibility of racial profiling.
